settings.what_you_need: 32g Grind ground coffee (16g for 1 cup)
Timer (we won’t judge if you use your phone)

settings.step_descriptions: Measure out 30g of ground coffee and place it into the brewer. If you don’t have a weighing scale, you’ll want roughly 2 heaped tablespoons.
Pour 500g/500ml of hot water over your coffee.
Gently stir the coffee to make sure all of your grounds are saturated by the water.
Pop the lid on-top, but don’t plunge just yet. Set your timer for a minimum of 4 minutes - the longer your brew, the more flavours you’ll extract from the coffee and the stronger your brew will be.
Push the plunger down so it sits just below the surface of the liquid. Pour your coffee.

settings.title: French Press
settings.text: Classic, timeless, and one of the oldest, most reliable ways of brewing filter coffee at home. The french press is extremely simple to use, requires minimal preparation, and makes great tasting, full-bodied coffee. This brewer uses no filter papers and is easy to clean; all you need is hot water, coffee, and you’re ready to brew! A must have for all coffee lovers.
settings.before_we_start_content:
- 16g Ground Coffee

- 250g Filtered water

- 2.5 -3 minutes brew time
settings.final_touch_content:
Enjoy your Grind coffee black or with milk.
We recommend the Grind Milk Frother, if you’re using milk for the perfect coffee.
